intro: Drosanthe hirtella, commonly known as the wooly drosanthe, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, surrounded by soft, hairy foliage. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats along the coastline. Drosanthe hirtella is a hardy perennial that is well adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native range.
